revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=TL-WDR4900 |revision=v1 |series=N900 |asin= |est_release_date=01/2013 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=Yes |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=TE7WDR4900 |ic_id=8853A-WDR4900 |pcb_id=2050500289 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Freescale |cpu1_model=P1014 |cpu1_cspeed=800 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=FL128SAIF00 |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5TQ1G63DFR-H9C |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9580 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9381 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8327N |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware=OpenWrt, DD-WRT |802dot11_protocols=abgn |addl_chips= |default_ssid=TP-LINK_2.4GHz_XXXXXX, TP-LINK_5GHz_XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=A0:F3:C1,F8:1A:67 |oui_eth=A0:F3:C1,F8:1A:67 }} {{TagLine|N900 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router}} :[http://www.tp-link.com/en/products/details/?categoryid=2477&model=TL-WDR4900 Product page] {{•}} [http://www.tp-link.com/resources/simulator/TL-WDR4900/Index.htm Firmware Interface] {{•}} [http://www.tplink.com/en/support/download/?model=TL-WDR4900&version=V1 Downloads]
"2050500289" and "Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board.
*CPU: [[Freescale Semiconductor]] QorIQ P1014 (@800MHz) :Hardware NAT acceleration w/ [[Atheros]] AR8327N switch :(.. but not currently, [https://dev.openwrt.org/ticket/11779 or likely anytime soon, with OpenWrt])
===Links=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=42062 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] ([http://pastebin.com/Mf6xNjwD OpenWrt boot log posted by ''Gabor Juhos'']) :[[Freescale]] P1014 @800MHz (P1014RDB board), 128MB DRAM, :168c:abcd (hm.) and 168c:0033 (AR9580) PCI IDs
*[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4900 On the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] :There would appear to be two versions of the device.. :*v1 - worldwide version, ''[[Freescale]]'' based :**F8:1A:67 OUI, per the censored label :**[https://dev.openwrt.org/changeset/36051 changeset (r36051) adding profile build image for the device] :*v2 - China only, '''QCA''' QCA9558 based :**[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=42099 v2 on the OpenWrt forums]
*[http://www.redeszone.net/tp-link/tl-wdr4900/ Review on redeszone.net (ES)] (w/ excellent internal photos) :De-heatsinkized CPU visible as a [http://www.freescale.com/webapp/sps/site/prod_summary.jsp?code=P1010 ''Freescale'' P1014NSN5HFA (P1014)] :- not a P1010.. but there does not appear to be anything significantly :different between the two models [http://cache.freescale.com/files/32bit/doc/brochure/P1010APPBRF.pdf?fpsp=1 P1010 appears to have 3x GbE SGMII] :(vs. P1014's 2x) and trusted boot support :WiFi chips visible in their photos as AR9580 (AR9580-AR1A) and AR9381 :USB 2.0 hub (P1014 has only 1x USB 2.0) is a [http://www.genesyslogic.com/_en/product_01_1.php?id=42 '''Genesys Logic''' GL850G]. *[http://uk.hardware.info/reviews/3992/tp-link-tl-wdr4900-review-tp-links-best-router-yet Review on uk.hardware.info] :specifies WiFi chips as AR9385 ('''no''') and AR9381
===Specifications=== Per '''TP-LINK''''s specs... *'''EIRP:''' < 20dBm *'''Receiver sensitivity''' **2.4GHz ***450Mbps: -71dBm ***300Mbps: -71dBm ***270Mbps: -71dBm ***195Mbps: -72dBm ***130Mbps: -74dBm ***54Mbps: -78dBm ***6Mbps: -94dBm **5GHz ***450Mbps: -66dBm ***405Mbps: -66dBm (300Mbps??) ***270Mbps: -67dBm ***195Mbps: -70dBm ***130Mbps: -73dBm ***54Mbps: -75dBm ***6Mbps: -90dBm
==Images== <gallery caption="from TP-LINK"> File:TL-WDR4900-01.jpg File:TL-WDR4900-02.jpg File:TL-WDR4900-03.jpg File:TL-WDR4900-04.jpg File:TL-WDR4900-05.jpg </gallery>[[Has images::external| ]]
